author: Snazzy Labs
description:
I thought I knew how much engineering went into a smart speaker—Amazon proved me wrong.
Check out the new Echo Studio at Amazon - https://snazzy.fm/na
Check out the new Echo Dot Max at Amazon - https://snazzy.fm/da

*Get my new merch at Copland Supply:* https://copland.supply
Follow Snazzy Labs on Twitter - https://twitter.com/snazzylabs  
Follow me on Bluesky - https://snazzy.fm/UW
Follow me on Threads - https://snazzy.fm/XV
Follow me on Mastodon - https://snazzy.fm/NN
Follow me on Instagram - https://instagram.com/snazzyq

Amazon's Echo Dot Max and Echo Studio smart speakers are engineered at Amazon Audio Labs in Bellevue, where acoustic engineers, thermal specialists, and industrial designers battle over every cubic millimeter of internal volume. Custom AZ-3 and AZ-3 Pro silicon enables edge AI processing for wake word detection and noise reduction, while OmniSense technology uses Wi-Fi radar, ultrasonic sensors, and accelerometers for presence detection and smart home automation.
title: I Toured Amazon's Secret Speaker Lab
